basics.name: Victor Panisa
basics.label: Master in Applied Computing
basics.summary:
I am a technical expert with more than 10 years of experience as working as a general system engineer, delivering real value and reducing operational costs in each position that I was responsible for.

I've helped the design, building and troubleshooting of many complex environments, and provided training and guidance for many colleagues.

I'm able to communicate fluently in English, Spanish and Portuguese, while also being graduated Master in Applied Computing. With proven experience in Linux, Python, C# and low-level systems architecture, including C and Assembly language, I'm motivated the most by challenges and ideas that have a positive impact on people's lives.

positions.title: Application Manager
positions.summary: Application infrastructure management, including server configuration, Linux, OpenShift, WebSphere MQ, uDeploy, Black Duck.

positions.title: Python Instructor
positions.summary: Training and support for Data Science activities with Python and Jupyter. Developing activities using Data Cleansing, Machine Learning, Regression and Business Intelligence.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.summary: C# essential solutions maintenance, expansion of new functionalities, performance improvements with asynchronous programming, training and knowledge sharing of other developers, development of Data Science activities and Big Data consolidation to control and improve the Digital Transformation Index of the regional units.

positions.title: Technical Lead
positions.summary: C# solutions development involving architectural definitions, workflow alignment, squad motivation, KPIs monitoring with the project team, making facilitating libraries, standardizing documentation, training and knowledge growth on a 6 month special project using scrum methodology.

positions.title: Systems Engineer
positions.summary: Software-oriented test and deployment of mixed WAN environments, with troubleshooting and integration of proprietary appliances and third-party applications ED-137 compliant, including VoIP, IP Radios and monitoring with remote and in-person activities on Austria’s office.

positions.title: Network Analyst
positions.summary: Experience in network engineering and deployment on projects for São Paulo government, including project design, segmentation, troubleshooting, configuration and monitoring of dispersed and multi-vendor environments, implementation of Python scripts for network assets configuration backup, and system administration and monitoring of enviromnts with HP MC.

positions.title: C# Developer
positions.summary: Development of web applications in the MVC model with C# ASP.NET and MSSQL database, for contract management, mirroring of point and record of activities of the resources. Including, but not limited to: integration of data with external sources; report generation with Crystal Reports; dynamic charts with JavaScript; data collection with Python scripts.

positions.title: Support Analyst
positions.summary: Acting in implementation and support in contact center’s applications for process automation, including creation, configuration and maintenance of software upgrade scripts in Python, MSSQL database analysis, requirements gathering, training and troubleshooting. Deployment, configuration and maintenance of PFSense firewall, and system administration and monitoring of environments with Nagios.

positions.title: IT Intern
positions.summary: Contact Center’s operations maintenance and support, including hardware and software configuration, automatic inventory and VoIP monitoring in Avaya environment with Python scripts.

publications.name: Design and Analysis of Object-Oriented Feedback Process Scheduler in User Level
publications.summary:
Some operating systems need modularity between their components as one of the main factors to implement a microkernel that is both secure and fault tolerant. When we consider dealing with operating system structures as objects, we see that it greatly helps to implement the desired modularity in these systems. The purpose of this article is to present an object-oriented design for a feedback process scheduler that runs on user mode. The authors show the details of the original structured implementation, the new pro-posed design, and show the adopted mechanism to interface the new scheduler and the other servers or even the kernel.

Vol. 11 No. 08
Issue 08/2017 (96)
ISSN 1898-9144
